Notes: Pre 1950s óstán/ósdán, teach/tigh ósta/ósda in Irish
Pre-1950s bliadhain in Irish. The form bliadhna (bliana today) is used as a special plural form following numerals
column5: the regular plural is blianta). Some eastern Scottish Gaelic dialects use the form bliadhn[8].

Notes: Also réidió and rèidio in spoken Irish and Scottish Gaelic
Pre-1950s genitive ríogh and dative rígh in Irish
In Irish, eaglais is a Roman Catholic house of worship
column5: a Protestant house of worship is called a teampall (temple). As Gaeilge 'séipéal' is also used as it can mean chapel as well.
